snippet: The rate of infant deaths fell more than 13 percent from 2005 to 2013 and by 2.3 percent in 2014, but the United States still has one of the highest rates among the richest nations.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports infant mortality in United States fell 2.3 percent in 2014 to new low of 582.1 infant deaths per 100,000 live births; fewer preterm births are cited for decline.
lead_paragraph: The rate of infant deaths fell more than 13 percent from 2005 to 2013 and by 2.3 percent in 2014, but the United States still has one of the highest rates among the richest nations.

headline.main: U.S. Reports a New Low in Deaths of Infants
headline.print_headline: U.S. Reports a New Low in Deaths of Infants

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
